    • set

      public void set(SuController.ControlMode mode, double setpoint)
      Description copied from class: SuController
      Set the motor output based on a control mode to a given setpoint. The setpoint will be sought using the configured sensor and the integrated PID controller, if configured and available. Note that the sensor configuration reduction will be respected by this method.
      Specified by:
      set in class SuController
      Parameters:
      mode - Control Mode to use, with the following options supported:

      PERCENT_OUTPUT: a percentage from -1.0 to 1.0 that directly regulates the motor's output power to that percentage of the input voltage

      POSITION: position from starting position (or from set zero) in degrees.

      VELOCITY: rate of rotation in revolutions per minute (rpm)

      VOLTAGE: commands the motor controller to regulate directly to the specified value in volts

    • set

      public void set(SuController.ControlMode mode, double setpoint, double arbFfVolts)
      Description copied from class: SuController
      Same as SuController.set(ControlMode, double), however this supports an additional arbitrary feed forward value, specified in Volts.

      The Arbitrary feed forward value should be specified in Volts relative to a nominal 12V. This value is passed to the motor controller and used as an "offset" from the zero point to help correct mechanism motion. For example, this can be used to calculate an offset to overcome static friction or gravity using the TrapezoidProfile in WPILib.

      Note that this mode is only supported in closed loop control modes (Position, Velocity).

      Specified by:
      set in class SuController
      Parameters:
      mode - See SuController.set(ControlMode, double) for description, only POSITION or VELOCITY may be used.
      setpoint - See SuController.set(ControlMode, double) for description
      arbFfVolts - An arbitrary feedforward value to feed the motor in volts.

    • outputPosition

      public double outputPosition()
      Description copied from class: SuController
      Using the SensorConfiguration on this motor, retreive the end effector position in degrees. This will take into account the scaling factor provided in the SensorConfiguration.
      Specified by:
      outputPosition in class SuController

    • outputVelocity

      public double outputVelocity()
      Description copied from class: SuController
      Using the SensorConfiguration on this motor, retreive the end effector output velocity in RPM. This will take into account the scaling factor provided in the SensorConfiguration.
      Specified by:
      outputVelocity in class SuController

    • setSensorPosition

      public void setSensorPosition(double position)
      Description copied from class: SuController
      setSensorPosition will override the current sensor position and update the internal counter to the new position. As with outputPosition, the value is in degrees.
      Specified by:
      setSensorPosition in class SuController
